title: The Cost of Intelligence is Collapsing
concept: A horizontal bar chart showing the cost per million output tokens for 6 major LLM providers in early 2026. The dramatic visual story: DeepSeek V3.2 at $0.42 vs Claude Opus at $75 — a 178x difference. The bars should make this ratio viscerally obvious. The cheapest models are at the top, most expensive at the bottom, creating a visual cliff. Clean data visualization, conference-quality.

format.bleed: Full bleed, no borders, no frames

background.texture: None — clean white-ish for data readability

chart.orientation: Model names on the left y-axis, cost on the x-axis
chart.sort_order: Cheapest at top, most expensive at bottom

bar_style.value_labels: Right-aligned at the end of each bar, inside or just outside

annotations.text: Output tokens cost 3-8x more than input across all providers

title.text: The Cost of Intelligence is Collapsing

color_palette_summary.note: Three-tier color coding: gold=cheap, coral=frontier, dark=premium

style_summary.technique: Clean data visualization. No chartjunk. Tufte-inspired.
style_summary.influences: Edward Tufte, Our World in Data, The Economist chart style

critical_requirements: Bars MUST show the dramatic 178x cost range clearly
Value labels MUST be on every bar
The '178x difference' annotation is essential — it's the takeaway
Must be readable from the back of a lecture hall
